title: Ukraine war: Russians fed twisted picture and one voice - that of Putin
description: Officials and Russian media have started pinning the murders of civilians on Kyiv in ominous rhetoric.

title: Black Coffee - the South African DJ who made history at the Grammys
description: The Grammy-award winner speaks to the BBC about the joy of his win and desire to never be pigeon-holed.

title: Bafta Games Awards 2022: 'Plucky underdogs' go up against hit titles
description: Hit titles go up against games made by four people during the pandemic "because they were bored".

title: Helmut Sonneberg: A spellbinder's story of survival, no longer kept secret
description: Helmut Sonneberg is a Holocaust survivor who for years did not speak of its horrors. His football club encouraged him to bear witness.

title: Are paper football programmes on their way out?
description: As a number of clubs stop printing programmes some say their future is in doubt.

title: Chelsea face biggest escapology task yet to overturn Champions League deficit against Real Madrid
description: Chelsea have a habit of snatching successes in the face of adversity but is a Champions League turnaround against Real Madrid beyond them?

title: Ukraine's dream of a Eurovision win
description: Kalush Orchestra are the bookies’ favourites to win the competition in Turin next month.

title: Jane Austen's Chawton home visited by Camilla after roof restoration
description: The Duchess of Cornwall saw the shirt worn by Colin Firth in Pride and Prejudice on her visit.

title: Boyfriend message in a bottle appeal found in Humber Estuary 55 years later
description: The pair of notes from girls looking for love were discovered yards from where they were launched.

title: Who are Putin's daughters? What we know about his family
description: The Russian president says he has daughters, but has given little information about them.

title: Tribute paid to Max, the springer spaniel who changed lives
description: Max the Miracle Dog became an internet star with people around the world watching his daily walks.

title: Two sets of quintuplet lambs are born in Swindon
description: A farm near Swindon is celebrating the arrival of two rare sets of quintuplet lambs.

title: The hunt for superyachts of sanctioned Russian oligarchs
description: Wealthy Russians sanctioned by the US, EU and UK are having to find places they can keep their assets safe.

title: Man arrested after scared York woman pretended to ring for pizza
description: A man is arrested after a woman became worried for her safety and rang police covertly.

title: Prime Minister Boris Johnson says transgender women should not compete in women's sport
description: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson says he does not believe transgender women should compete in female sporting events.

title: Ukraine war: Bucha deaths 'not far short of genocide' - PM
description: Boris Johnson says the alleged Russian atrocities in the Ukrainian town will lead to more sanctions.

title: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky addresses the Irish parliament
description: President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelensky has thanked the people of Ireland for supporting his country.

title: Looe sand drawing remembers Falklands War veterans
description: The drawing was commissioned to remember veterans on the 40th anniversary of the war.

title: National Insurance rise starts to hit pay packets
description: The prime minister says it is fair for some to face an extra tax burden to pay for health and social care.

title: Manchester Arena: Man admits vandalising bomb victims' memorial
description: Anwar Hosseni caused £10,000 of damage to the memorial for those killed in the Manchester attack.

title: Bowen: This is the worst I have seen around Kyiv
description: Borodyanka's residents say Russian forces stopped them from digging for survivors amidst town's destruction.

title: Can Arslan: Victim's family criticises 'toothless' police response
description: Matthew Boorman's family say mistakes were made by the authorities that must never be repeated.

title: Australia landslide: Tributes paid to UK family after deaths in Blue Mountains
description: A father who died with his son in the Australian mountains is named as lawyer Mehraab Nazir.

title: Matt Le Tissier 'steps aside' from ambassador role at Southampton
description: Matt Le Tissier says he has "stepped aside" from his role as ambassador at former club Southampton.

title: Ed Sheeran wins Shape of You copyright case and hits out at 'baseless' claims
description: After the High Court judgement, the singer says such "baseless" claims "are way too common now".

title: Masters: Larry Mize on 1987 winning chip - 'it looked good, I was just frozen watching it'
description: In 1987 Larry Mize won the Masters in a thrilling play-off, chipping in at the 11th to deny Greg Norman, a shot that would change his life forever.

title: Isle of Wight: Council's electric vehicle chargers hacked to show porn site
description: Isle of Wight Council says staff are covering up the "inappropriate" website showing on the screen.

title: Ben Stokes: England vice-captain waiting on result of knee scan
description: England vice-captain Ben Stokes says he cannot make any plans for this summer until he has had a scan to assess the extent of a knee problem.

title: Flight cancellations continue due to staff shortages
description: Passengers facing disruption ahead of Easter, the first holiday since Covid travel restrictions ended.

title: Covid vaccine festival cost £535 per person jabbed
description: A festival organised by a London council to encourage vaccination saw just 435 people getting jabbed.

title: Joy Division and Coronation Street treasures launch British Pop Archive
description: Handwritten lyrics by Joy Division's Ian Curtis and Granada TV's entire archive are among the items.

title: Falklands War: Royal Navy veteran who fired first shots
description: Chris Parry was a lieutenant in 1982 when his crew spotted an Argentine submarine.

title: Rare identical Cheshire triplets were 'one-in-200 million'
description: Gina and Craig Dewdney reflect on the "best but hardest job" as their three boys turn one.

title: Carlo Ancelotti: Real Madrid manager on brink of history – so why is his job on line?
description: As Real Madrid prepare to meet Chelsea in the first leg of the Champions League quarter-final at Stamford Bridge on Wednesday, is boss Carlo Ancelotti still in serious danger of being fired?

title: Osian Jones: 'I want people to know I'm part of the LGBTQ+ community,' says Welsh hammer thrower
description: Welsh athlete Osian Jones - who has been to two Commonwealth Games - tells the BBC's LGBT Sport Podcast why he is ready to speak publicly about his sexuality for the first time.

title: Covid: React study finds latest wave 'may have peaked' in young
description: But the final React study found "worrying" signs that infections are still rising in those over 55.
